snippet: The gift, worth about $115 million, from Michael Moritz, a Silicon Valley venture capitalist, and his wife, Harriet Heyman, will help low-income students attend the university.
abstract: University of Oxford announces a $115 million donation from Michael Moritz, an alumnus and a major Silicon Valley venture capitalist, as the cornerstone of a $460 million fund dedicated to reducing debt for disadvantaged students; the first 100 scholarships are to be awarded in the fall of 2012.
lead_paragraph: The gift, worth about $115 million, from Michael Moritz, a Silicon Valley venture capitalist, and his wife, Harriet Heyman, will help low-income students attend the university.

headline.seo: Oxford Gets $115 Million From Web Investor, Moritz
headline.main: Oxford Gets Major Donation for Student Aid
